captions.text: What exists in every corner of the world - embraced and celebrated in some countries
but is illegal in 76?
What is hidden for fear of public shame, imprisonment,
torture or in 7 countries
even the death penalty?
What tears families apart?

What makes people confront the risk of brutal
violence on a daily basis?

What simple trait gets people treated as second-class
citizens everywhere they go?
What gets children kicked out of homes,
students bullied and expelled from schools
and workers fired from jobs without warning?
What has existed in every country throughout history
but some people still consider "abnormal"?
The answer?
Being gay,
being lesbian
bisexual
or transgender

All over the world millions of people face
violence and discrimination
Just for being who they are
Every nation is obligated by international human rights law
to protect all lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people
from torture, discrimination and violence
The United Nations has one simple message
to the millions of LGBT people around the world
You are not alone
LGBT rights are human rights
Together we will build a world
We will build a world
that is Free and Equal

title: The Riddle: new anti-homophobia message from UN human rights office

comments.text:
Of the adverse social effects of homosexuality none is more significant 
than the effect on marriage and home. The normal, God-given sexual 
relationship is the procreative act between man and a woman in honorable 
marriage. It was so expressed and commanded to the first man and woman on 
the earth in Genesis. 

The institution of marriage is further elevated in the 132nd Section of the 
Doctrine and Covenants, wherein the Lord makes clear that only through the 
eternal union of man and woman can they achieve eternal life. As an 
example, he says that the wife is given to the man to multiply and 
replenish the earth, according to my commandment, and to fulfill the 
promise which was given by my Father before the foundation of the world, 
and for their exaltation in the eternal worlds, that they may bear the 
souls of men; for herein is the work of my Father continued, that he may be 
glorified. Such references of course relate to celestial marriage.

In this context, where stands the perversion of homosexuality? Clearly it 
is hostile to Gods purpose in that it negates his first and great 
commandment to multiply and replenish the earth. If the abominable practice 
became universal it would depopulate the earth in a single generation. It 
would nullify Gods great program for his spirits in the heavenly world 
without the chance for the opportunities of mortality and would deny to all 
the participants in the practice the eternal life God makes available to us 
all.

Many have been misinformed that they are powerless in the matter, not 
responsible for the tendency, and that ‘God made them that way.’ This is as 
untrue as any other of the diabolical lies Satan has concocted. It is 
blasphemy. Man is made in the image of God. Does the pervert think God to 
be ‘that way’? . . .

But let us emphasize that right and wrong, righteousness and sin, are not 
dependent upon man's interpretations, conventions, and attitudes.  Social 
acceptance does not change the status of an act, making wrong into right. 
 If all the people in the world were to accept homosexuality, as it seems 
to have been accepted in Sodom and Gomorrah, the practice would still be 
deep, dark sin.﻿

until their children slowly die and calling that more righteous than war. 
Or calling for immediate human rights action in some part of the world, 
while almost giving a go ahead to Pol Pot. Does it really serve humanity, 
or merely takes part in these anti-homophobia movements to bolster its 
reputation? And I think the individuals in this video could have done this 
without any help from the UN. The USSR has contributed to social movements 
in the US but it's still horrible.﻿

comments.author: Armando Santos

comments.text:
+Armando Santos
Considering the fact that in order to develop an understanding of what 
"human nature" you must examine every single human being on the planet, and 
then see what DOESN'T exist in their behavior makes the definition very 
vague. 

Your definition is regarding whether or not it is "suppose" to happen in 
nature or not. If something exists, doesn't that equate to being "natural" 
because if it didn't it wouldn't exist at all. 

For example it is not natural for humans to digest titanium, it is not 
natural for humans to fly (I'm talking about biologically, yes we design 
equipment that helps us fly, but we cannot fly ourselves with the bodies 
that we were born with.) 

However is it does exist, then how is it still unnatural? From what you 
said, yes apparently it is natural for a human to have sex with another 
species, is it morally questionable, absolutely since it can be categorized 
as rape and animal abuse. Regardless, it is possible therefore it exists in 
nature, therefore it is natural. 

What I am trying to say is defining something to be "natural" or 
"unnatural" is not a very good way to make your claim, because the 
definition can vary from person to person, on top of that, the definition 
itself is very vague and holds no absolute values. 

Biologists use the term "natural" as a simple verification on whether or 
not something exists in nature or not (ei: rocks are not natural, but 
plants are), and this to me seems to be the best possible way to define the 
term "natural" since it can be easily differentiated with a yes or a no.

comments.text:
Human beings are social and cultural living beings whose cultures and 
societies have been constructed historically, that means by the 
confrontation of different social-political forces who want to rule the 
power. It is just like that how discrimination and repression against 
homosexual sexuality originated. Everybody can easily realize that reading 
the very well documented (with factical arguments, not with idealistic 
narrow-minded analysis) book "History of sexuality" by Michel Foucault 
(1976). 

To go deeper about the "natural" and causalist usage of body. At first, 
nothing made by human beings can be considered "natural", because the word 
"artificial" means etymologically "human made". By the way, do not forget 
that "normal" is an statistical concept that means "the most repeated 
distribution"; not exactly the best or the right one. So, we are not 
impulsed by our nature to use our genitals for reproduction (Butler, 1997; 
Preaciado, 2003), but for satisfying our sexual desires (Freud, 1995; 
Lacan, 1957). Actually, clitoris is an organ that works just for satisfying 
woman; it has no reproductive function. Thinking timeless and not 
historically as causalism and naturalism do, as in the story of Adam and 
Eve, nobody orders us to use our biology for reproduction. So reproduction 
is a cultural aim (Bohannan, 1996), and a political one (Foucault, 1976) as 
it is used in Demography to control the number of population and their 
productive distribution by contraceptives. 

The only one reason why homosexuals are condemned is because they go 
against the political-economic system which wants our maximum production 
organized as productive and reproductive families. And it is not God who's 
judging and discrimination homos, but conservative and narrow-minded 
people; or is God maybe punishing homosexuals nowadays? No, and the case of 
Sodom and Gomorrah hasn't been proved archeologically yet as actual. Do you 
not know how many suicides of homosexual teens and unhappiness of many 
repressed older homosexuals have caused those ideas, allegedly disseminated 
by God's people? Please read the statistics. 

Being homosexual does not cause any harm, but discrimination - social and 
political unequal treaty - does. Agatha Rosendahl; B.A. in Natural 
Sciences; M.A. in Anthropology and Sexuality.﻿
